article_title: Elica, Cares receive federal funds to serve Sacramento’s poor
article_text:
About This Blog

The Sacramento Bee's team of health reporters covers California health care, medicine and healthy living, with an emphasis on public health and under-served communities.Sammy Caiola: Health care and healthy living. Reach her at scaiola@sacbee.com or 916-321-1636. Twitter: @SammyCaiola Claudia Buck: Public health and consumer issues. Reach her at cbuck@sacbee.com or 916-321-1968. Twitter: @Claudia_Buck Funding for this reporting is paid, in part, by The California Endowment, a private foundation that promotes healthy communities through grants and education. All coverage decisions are made by The Bee.

article_metadata.news-keywords: Cares Community Health, Elica Health Centers, Sacramento, federal grant, affordable care act
article_metadata.description: Two of Sacramento’s community health clinics got a major boost after U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell recently announced the allocation of about $100 million in Affordable Care Act funding to 164 health sites serving low-income patients.
article_metadata.title: Elica, Cares receive federal funds to serve Sacramento’s poor | The Sacramento Bee
